responses.rationale: Describes scientists 'watching H5N1 closely' (surveillance/preparedness).
Describes criteria for detecting spread ('you have to have a confirmed case... and then you just start picking up additional human cases') which relates to surveillance capability.
Asks 'How would we know if the virus was spreading more widely in people?' referring to detection methods (capability).
Discusses the source of exposure, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Discusses the likely source of exposure, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Asks about the likely source of exposure, not a capability or preparedness measure.
States the source of exposure, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes how the virus caused infection and severity, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Expresses concern about pandemic risk, not a capability or preparedness measure.
States 'you have to keep your eye on it' which implies monitoring (preparedness).
Describes past events and predictions, not current capability or preparedness.
Describes past events, not current capability or preparedness.
Describes past events, not current capability or preparedness.
Statement about past experience, not a specific capability or preparedness measure.
Discusses past fatal cases and asks about risk, not a capability or preparedness measure.
States past fatal cases occurred, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Asks about why infections are milder, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Identifies pigs as a 'sentinel' species, relating to surveillance (capability).
Describes past cases and changes in the virus, not current capability or preparedness.
Describes past cases, not current capability or preparedness.
Describes past cases and risk assessment, not current capability or preparedness.
States a low risk assessment, which is active reassurance (Rule C), not a capability without reassurance.
Asks about likelihood of spread, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Discusses symptoms and potential exposure route, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes a past case and testing, not current capability or preparedness.
Introduces an expert and topic, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Compares past and current cases, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes a past case, not current capability or preparedness.
States the new case is the second and describes the first, not current capability or preparedness.
States the new case is the second, not a capability or preparedness measure.
States 'risk to the public remains low' which is active reassurance (Rule C), not a capability without reassurance.
States where infections have been found, not a capability or preparedness measure.
States which mammalian species have been infected, not a capability or preparedness measure.
States 'The patient is being treated with antiviral medication' (response measure).
Describes patient exposure and symptoms, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Reports a person tested positive, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes FDA 'conducting ongoing tests' (surveillance/capability) and 'cautioned against consuming raw milk' (safeguard).
Describes 'Lab experiments... continue to confirm that pasteurization inactivates the bird flu virus' (capability/safeguard).
Describes shots that 'could potentially be used to inoculate farm workers' (future possibility/capability).
States doses 'could be available as early as this month' (availability/preparedness).
Describes officials 'moving bulk vaccine... into finished shots that could provide 4.8 million doses if needed' (preparedness/capability).
States manufacturing 'can take four to six months' (capability/process description).
Describes 'mRNA vaccine technology offers advantages' (capability description).
States vaccines 'use messenger RNA, the technology used in their COVID-19 vaccines' (capability description).
States agency was 'negotiating with Pfizer for an mRNA vaccine' (preparedness/capability).
States government 'expects to have more announcements on H5N1 vaccines in the near future' (future plans/preparedness).
States 'robust discussions are occurring within government agencies about whether vaccinating farm workers would be helpful' (preparedness/planning).
States 'The risk to the general public from bird flu remains low' which is active reassurance (Rule C), not a capability without reassurance.
Describes scientists' concerns about mutation risk, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Reports past outbreaks in cattle, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Discusses manufacturing capability ('how many doses Moderna will be able to manufacture').
Describes contract options 'to accelerate the development timeline if needed' (capability/preparedness).
Describes the focus of a future trial ('late-stage trial would likely focus on safety and immune response') (capability/preparedness).
States 'late-stage testing would begin in 2025' (timeline/preparedness).
States 'Funds... will be used to complete late-stage development and testing' (funding/capability).
States government 'has awarded $176 million to Moderna to advance development of its bird flu vaccine' (funding/capability).
States EFSA 'recommended rapid implementation of risk mitigation and surveillance strategies' (recommendation for preparedness/safeguards).
Reports detections in birds, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes the severity of the crisis, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes the geographical reach and spread, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Discusses risk to wild birds, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes transmission method, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes past outbreaks and mortality, not current capability or preparedness.
Describes the spread and concerns, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes the worst crisis and increased risk, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Quote about needing 'to take decisive action' (implies need for response/capability).
Quote about needing 'to get this thing out of the dairy cow populations' (implies need for response/capability).
States officials 'should test wastewater... and investigate the source' (recommended surveillance/capability).
Quote about what 'a really consistent wastewater signal' would show (surveillance capability).
States 'Wastewater analyses have shown H5N1 spikes' (results of surveillance/capability).
Refers to 'other tools that help officials gauge the extent of the outbreak' (capabilities).
Discusses reluctance to compel testing, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Uses a metaphor about difficulty finding cases, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Discusses factors making identification difficult, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Discusses opportunities for mutation, not a capability or preparedness measure.
States officials 'were able to sequence only a portion of the virus' (capability/action taken).
States a recounting 'would help clarify how the virus might have spread' (potential benefit of an action/capability).
Discusses what ideally should have happened with an investigation, not current capability.
Quote about public health credibility, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Quote criticizing messaging tone, not a capability or preparedness measure.

Criticizes information flow and lack of details, not a capability or preparedness measure.
States 'The investigation is led by Missouri health officials with remote assistance from the C.D.C.' (response measure/capability).
States 'Officials are now analyzing results of antibody tests' (surveillance/capability).
States 'the C.D.C. added four more health care workers to the list of possible cases' (action taken in response/surveillance).

States 'Some are undergoing further tests' (surveillance/capability).

States the turkey infections are the first since 2020, not a capability or preparedness measure.

States staff 'have reached out... to schedule testing of birds' (surveillance/capability).

States imports 'will also be suspended' (safeguard).
States products 'may be imported under a veterinary permit' (safeguard/regulation).
States which countries are affected by the suspension, not a capability or preparedness measure itself.
States Namibia 'halted imports of live poultry from 10 countries' (safeguard).
